abstract: The first of the Carpetbagger's looks at the season's Scene Stealers is the actor who played Hemingway in "Midnight in Paris." Watch the video with Corey Stoll.
lead_paragraph: Corey Stoll was just a little-known actor who happened to be appearing opposite Scarlett Johansson in "A View From the Bridge" on Broadway when Woody Allen - who cast Ms. Johansson in his film "Match Point" -- came to see the show. Not long after, Mr. Stoll, best known from his role as the bald detective on the short-lived "Law & Order: Los Angeles," was called in to see Mr. Allen about a part in "Midnight in Paris." He was duly petrified but wound up with the role of Hemingway. He donned a wig and a mustache, and on screen he was one of the most memorable stars in a cast that included Owen Wilson and Marion Cotillard.

headline.main: A Role That Was Good and True and Stole the Scene
